title: Ticket #4573: Migrate HTCondor-CE classad function userHome to HTCondor proper
description:
HTCondor-CE contains two additional classad functions we need for things to actually work:
  • eval_rsl: This takes a Globus RSL expression and evaluates to a ClassAd.
  • user_home: This takes a username and returns the corresponding home directory name (equivalent to expanding ~).

These need to be migrated to the core HTCondor codebase due to the lack of versioning for plugins (causing potentials for crashes if a site uses a version of libclassad different from what we compiled against). I'll file a separate ticket for plugins.
remarks:
2014-Sep-17 11:20:18 by tannenba:
Seems like an OSG software packaging issue... why would the version of the classad plugin be different/version-skewed from the version of the rest of HTCondor CE?

Is the idea that sites can use their pre-existing HTCondor local site scheduler binaries for running their OSG HTCondor CE? Is that a good idea? Seems like that configuration should not be supported.

2014-Sep-17 13:44:32 by bbockelm:
Hi Todd,

The problem is that it is not possible to detect problems or potential versioning clashes.

There's also a "finding a good home" issue here - we'd like to keep HTCondor-CE simply a "configuration wrapper" for HTCondor. I don't want to end up like glideinWMS, which is a pretty thick layer on top of HTCondor. These are definitely code, so I really would like to find a good home for them in condor_compat.

Brian

2014-Sep-29 14:04:02 by tannenba:
Ok, we can add these into the compat layer code, assuming that the RSL function does not bring in yet another Globus GRAM dependency. Currently GRAM libs are only linked into the gahp, I wanna keep it that way...

2014-Sep-29 14:51:08 by bbockelm:
I'm fine with that!

2015-Feb-25 19:43:27 by bbockelm:
Talking with Jaime and Todd today - we plan on upstreaming only user_home as eval_rsl will be dropped in the long term.

I will submit a patch.

2015-Apr-08 15:52:17 by bbockelm:
Update from OSG/HTCondor call. This was supposed to be assigned to Brian, but didn't get done. Will tackle this for 8.3.6.

2015-May-09 09:33:47 by bbockelm:
Pushed a new version of this patch.

In this version, CLASSAD_ENABLE_USER_HOME must be set to true for the function to actually return the home directory.

This protection is added because of the potential for abuse - UserHome may always cause a LDAP lookup to get the information on some misconfigured hosts. We want to make sure no one accidentally puts this in an expression in an auto cluster attribute!

Sent to batlab for testing...

2015-Jun-05 14:24:39 by tim:
Not documenting this because of potential for abuse.

2015-Jun-05 14:33:28 by tim:
Needs to have CLASSAD_ENABLE_USER_HOME added to the param table.
